question.text: The reaction of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> with <math><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> in tetrahydrofuran gives inorganic benzene <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> . Further, the reaction of <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> with <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> leads to <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> . Compounds <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> respectively, are:

options.text: Bogging god <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math>

Diborane and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math>
Boron nitride and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math>

Borazine and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></math>

solution.text:
The reaction of H3N3B3Cl3A with LiBH4 in tetrahydrofuran gives inorganic benzene B. The reaction is given below.  Further, the reaction of compound  A reacts with C leads to H3N3B3Me3 .

The reaction is given beow:

 B3N3H3CI3A+LiBH4⟶B3N3H6B+LiCI+BCI3
B3N3H3CI3A+3MeMgBrC⟶B3N3H3CH33+3MgBrCI
